title: Welcome + Using the Command Line
description: In this lecture, we'll discuss the purpose of the class, and how it relates to other technical/programming concepts.  We'll also discuss how to begin using your command line to navigate your operating system.

title: Version control + Markdown
description: This lecture introduces the version control system git, in conjunction with GitHub as a hosting platform.  It also covers how to use Markdown syntax to create well formatted documents.

title: Intro to R
description: Today, we'll start using R, the software program we'll use throughout the quarter for working with data.  In particular, we'll cover variable types, vectors, and built-in functions.

title: Vectors and Functions in R
description: This lecture covers more advanced vector manipulation, writing your own functions, and conditional programming statements

title: Reading and Writing data
description: Compliments to the TA team who put together these slides to introduce the necessary concepts forreading and writing data in .csv format.

title: Lists and Dataframes
description: This lecture dives more deeply into the underlying structure of dataframes, and how to begin using them to ask questions about your data

title: Data Wrangling I
description: Today, we'll consider the different operations we perform to ask questions about our data, and introduce the "grammer of data manipulation" package, dplyr

title: Data Wrangling II
description: We'll expand on our last lecture on dplyr, and move into perfoming grouped operations and joining data.frames

title: Application Programming Interfaces
description: We'll introduce the concept of APIs, and hone in on how to access data from RESTful APIs in R

title: Rmarkdown
description: This lecture introduces RMarkdown as an approach to building dynamic reports in R.
